location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 6556 of 1850 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Lieutenant Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging the receipt of a communication from the Resident (No 39, dated 19 October 1850) concerning the detention of a Bahrain Ghaucha by the Governor of Lingah [Bandar-e-Lengeh], Shaikh Saeed ben Guzeeb; the Ghaucha had been seized by members of the Monasir tribe.
